title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' defenseman Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, which has a special meaning for them.
Lindholm returned to the Bruins lineup after a lower-body injury, contributing to team's improved record of 5-1-0 with him.
Coach Marco Sturm noted Lindholm's impact on team dynamics and defensive structure, key to recent wins.

title: Stefon Diggs playfully roasts Cardi B’s dance moves during Gillette Stadium appearance
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Cardi B attended the Patriots' game at Gillette Stadium, watching from the owner's suite with Robert Kraft.
Stefon Diggs playfully criticized Cardi B's dance moves as 'shaky' after imitating his touchdown celebration.
The Patriots secured a 1-point win against the Falcons, extending their winning streak to six games.

title: A bipartisan group of Mass. lawmakers called on Markey and Warren to help end the shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A bipartisan group of 32 Massachusetts lawmakers urged Senators Markey and Warren to help end the government shutdown.
Massachusetts lawmakers expressed concerns about shutdown impacts on federal workers, SNAP benefits, and small businesses.
Senators Markey and Warren have opposed a House-passed measure, advocating for a clean short-term spending bill.

title: ‘Unaffordable and nearly unlivable’: What readers want Mayor Wu and City Councilors to prioritize
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers prioritize housing affordability, citing high rents and inaccessibility for working- and middle-class Bostonians.
Public safety concerns focus on the Mass. and Cass crisis impacting community wellbeing and property values.
Infrastructure issues, including MBTA reliability and traffic congestion, are key quality-of-life concerns for Bostonians.

title: Business confidence in Massachusetts drops again, report says
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business confidence in Massachusetts decreased in October, marking the longest pessimistic period since the COVID-19 pandemic.
The AIM Business Confidence Index, running since 1991, showed concerns over rising prices, government disruptions, and tariffs.
Labor market concerns include slowing employment and rising long-term unemployment, affecting consumer spending in Massachusetts.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce date of 2026 home opener
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Legacy FC will debut in the NWSL on March 14, 2026, at Gillette Stadium at 12:30 p.m.
Legacy FC's first game will be nationally broadcast, with full 2026 schedule details pending.
The team needs to sign more players, having nine currently, to reach the NWSL minimum squad size of 18.

title: Six straight wins later — are the Patriots officially back?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The New England Patriots achieved a six-game win streak under new head coach Mike Vrabel and rookie QB Drake Maye.
Patriots hold a 7-2 record as standout players like Stefon Diggs and Rhamondre Stevenson contribute to the team's performance.
Head coach Mike Vrabel praised the team's resilience following their narrow 24-23 victory over the Atlanta Falcons.

title: New UMass poll shows Markey with firm lead over Moulton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Sen. Ed Markey leads Rep. Seth Moulton 51% to 28% among likely Democratic primary voters in the UMass Amherst/WCVB poll.
A race with potential candidate Rep. Ayanna Pressley involved would show Markey at 35%, Moulton at 25%, and Pressley at 21%.
Markey's top concern descriptor among voters is "old," while Moulton is considered "unknown," reflecting challenges for both candidates.

title: Mass. man missing after leaving hospital early Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Leonard Mercury, 57, went missing after leaving Heywood Hospital in Gardner, Massachusetts early Friday morning.
Mercury was last seen walking towards a bike path, wearing hospital clothes and no shoes.
Authorities urge anyone with information to call 911 or Gardner police due to health concerns.

title: ‘We’re feeling that first-snow magic’: New England ski resorts delight in the season’s first snow
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sunday River in Maine reported its first natural snowfall and shared photos on social media.
Bretton Woods in New Hampshire will open on November 28 following a light summit snow dusting.
Vermont's Jay Peak continues snowmaking and will open the day after Thanksgiving, as per tradition.
